decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the game by rapidly ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral, Nissa, and Incubation Druid, allowing for powerful plays like Mass Manipulation. Tamiyo helps with card selection and graveyard recursion, while Hydroid Krasis and Jadelight Ranger provide additional card advantage. The deck utilizes a mix of mana ramp and card draw to overwhelm opponents with large threats and disruptive plays, ultimately aiming to maintain control of the game and outvalue the opponent.

The main strategy of this Esper Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the game by disrupting the opponent's plays and generating card advantage. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Kaya's Wrath and Thought Erasure to deal with threats on the board. By controlling the game and out-valuing the opponent with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Search for Azcanta, the deck aims to ultimately win through card advantage and overwhelming the opponent with its powerful spells.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board through removal spells like Kaya's Wrath, Cast Down, and Moment of Craving, as well as disruption spells like Thought Erasure. The deck aims to gain card advantage and tempo with planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils. It also utilizes cards like Search for Azcanta to filter through the deck and find key cards. Additionally, the deck can leverage Command the Dreadhorde and The Elderspell to close out games or deal with opposing threats effectively.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and planeswalkers to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to maintain board presence through cards like Kaya's Wrath and Teferi, Time Raveler while also disrupting the opponent's hand with Thought Erasure and Narset, Parter of Veils. The inclusion of Liliana, Dreadhorde General provides a win condition while also generating card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game and outvalue the opponent through a combination of removal, disruption, and card advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of powerful cards and spells from both white and blue mana sources to swiftly attack and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By utilizing cards like Hero of Precinct One and Thief of Sanity, along with counter spells like Thought Erasure and Despark, this deck creates a fast-paced aggressive playstyle that aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to establish their own game plan. Additionally, with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck gains additional control and card advantage to help secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deploy creatures like Arclight Phoenix and Crackling Drake, while supporting them with spells like Chart a Course, Lightning Strike, and Shock. By utilizing the graveyard with cards like Finale of Promise and Tormenting Voice, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats and burn spells, while maintaining card advantage with Augur of Bolas and God-Eternal Kefnet. The mana base of Islands, Mountains, Steam Vents, and Sulfur Falls allows for consistent casting of spells and creatures.

This deck focuses on maintaining control of the game through a combination of removal spells, counter spells, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by removing threats and countering key spells, while generating card advantage with cards like Chemister's Insight and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck also has powerful finishers in the form of Enter the God-Eternals, God-Eternal Kefnet, Liliana, Dreadhorde General, and Ugin, the Ineffable. By efficiently controlling the board and out-valuing the opponent, this deck seeks to establish dominance and win the game.

The deck focuses on playing aggressively with a mixture of creatures and spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to use cards like Arclight Phoenix, Crackling Drake, and Finale of Promise to quickly put pressure on the opponent while also utilizing powerful instant and sorcery spells to control the board and clear a path for the creatures to attack. The deck also includes card draw spells like Chart a Course and Opt to maintain card advantage and ensure a consistent flow of threats.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient combat tricks. By utilizing cards like Feather, the Redeemed and Tenth District Legionnaire, along with spells like Defiant Strike and Samut's Sprint, the deck aims to maintain a high tempo and pressure the opponent quickly. Cards like Aurelia, Exemplar of Justice and Legion Warboss provide additional threats and ways to push through damage. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive game plan, with a mix of dual lands and basic lands to ensure consistent casting of spells.

The main focus of this Esper Control deck is to control the board through powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler, along with disruptive spells like Thought Erasure and Tyrant's Scorn. Additionally, the deck utilizes creatures like Hero of Precinct One and Basilica Bell-Haunt to provide additional value and pressure. The deck also includes removal spells like Oath of Kaya and Despark to deal with threats efficiently. By combining these elements, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the game until it can secure a win condition.

This deck focuses on using disruptive spells like Duress and Thought Erasure to control the opponent's hand and board while deploying cheap, efficient threats like Hero of Precinct One and Thief of Sanity to apply pressure and win the game quickly. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Sorin, Vengeful Bloodlord to generate card advantage and provide additional threats. Overall, the strategy is to outvalue the opponent through a combination of disruption, card advantage, and aggressive creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish board control and disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of powerful creature threats, disruptive spells, and versatile planeswalkers. By utilizing a mix of removal spells, card advantage engines, and tempo play with cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Thief of Sanity, the deck aims to pressure the opponent and control the game's pace through aggressive yet strategic gameplay. Additionally, the deck relies on a solid mana base and efficient spells to consistently execute its game plan and outmaneuver the opponent.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to take control of the game through powerful planeswalkers like Nicol Bolas, the Ravager and Narset, Parter of Veils, while utilizing strong removal spells like Bedevil and Cry of the Carnarium to deal with opposing threats. The deck also includes card draw and disruption with Thought Erasure and Discovery / Dispersal, along with counterspells like Negate. The inclusion of powerful spells like Liliana, Dreadhorde General and The Elderspell adds versatility and powerful win conditions to the deck.

This deck focuses on creating massive amounts of mana through Wilderness Reclamation and cards like Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. It aims to continually loop Nexus of Fate to take extra turns, while using Tamiyo, Collector of Tales and Search for Azcanta to find key pieces of the combo. The deck also includes tools like Root Snare and Blink of an Eye to stall the opponent's aggression, while Blast Zone and Memorial to Genius provide additional utility. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and win through overwhelming advantage and extra turns.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively deal damage to the opponent using cheap and efficient creatures and burn spells. Cards like Goblin Chainwhirler and Viashino Pyromancer help control the board while Runaway Steam-Kin and Chandra, Fire Artisan provide additional damage and card advantage. The deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain a fast pace throughout the game, utilizing cards like Experimental Frenzy and Light Up the Stage to keep the cards flowing and the pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing Lazav's ability to copy creatures in the graveyard to power up combos with cards like Diligent Excavator and Teshar, Ancestor's Apostle. The goal is to quickly fill the graveyard with key creatures like Fblthp, the Lost and Chamber Sentry, then use Lazav's versatility to assemble powerful combinations that can win the game quickly. With a mix of mana acceleration like Mox Amber and card draw with Jace, Wielder of Mysteries, the deck aims to have a fast and consistent win condition through its combo interactions.
